title: Lesson 10
paragraph: Trade and distribution depend on persistence, insight, and evolving strategies. By retaining knowledge and emulating best practices, organizations can breed success and institute effective methods for global commerce.

words.meaning: to keep possession of or continue to have
words.example: She retained her position in the company.

words.meaning: to produce or cause something to develop
words.example: The program breeds innovation among young entrepreneurs.

words.meaning: to give out or deliver to multiple recipients
words.example: The charity distributed food to the needy.

words.meaning: a deep understanding of a situation
words.example: Her insight helped solve the complex problem.
The company evolved its business model successfully.

words.meaning: to make forceful or difficult efforts
words.example: They struggled to meet the deadline.

words.meaning: to continue firmly in an action or belief
to establish or set in motion
to imitate or strive to match
words.example: Young athletes emulate their role models.
